title: Biofeedback-Based Learning Design for Arousal State Management and Achievement Improvement

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic biosignals and experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Project-based assessment applying arousal state monitoring during learning to minimize low-arousal (boredom) states and improve achievement.

learning_goals: Learners can classify their arousal states with 80% or higher accuracy by interpreting biofeedback data
Learners can apply three or more self-regulation strategies contextually when low arousal states occur
Learners can demonstrate through project execution that arousal state management correlates with academic performance (r=0.6 or higher)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
